isis.stitle: TSI 08-12-04 - EGR Cooler and Bracket Installation Procedure

subjectgroup.subject: EGR Cooler and Bracket Installation Procedure

geninfo.para: A change has been made to the installation procedure of the Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR) cooler and bracket - exhaust side. The change is to tighten the two M12 x 70 EGR cooler bracket mounting bolts after (not before) the EGR cooler clamps.
Refer to EGES 335 Engine Service Manual, Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR) System section, page 134. Use the following procedure to modify your existing printed copy of the Engine Service Manual.

item.para: Re-number steps 7, 8, and 9 to steps 6, 7, and 8.
Circle new step 9 (old step 6) which reads "Tighten two M12 x 70 bolts to special torque (page 138)." and arrow down to follow in sequence after new step 8.

geninfo.para: These changes will be included in the EGES 335-1 version of the Engine Service Manualon the ISIS website.
See the following page for the new renumbered procedure.

svcproc.title: EGR Cooler and Bracket - Exhaust Side

figure.caption: Figure 1. Exhaust side EGR cooler and bracket

step1.para: Loosely assemble the exhaust side EGR cooler, cooler bracket, and two new EGR cooler clamps.
Install a new exhaust tube gasket on the exhaust side EGR cooler inlet flange studs.
Install exhaust side EGR cooler assembly on the exhaust manifold and install two M12 x 70 bolts finger tight.
Install M8 x 30 stud bolt and two M8 nuts and tighten to standard torque (page 471).
If the exhaust manifold was removed, torque exhaust manifold bolts to special torque in proper sequence (page 148).

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, install all EGR system components before tightening the EGR cooler clamps.

step1.para: Pre-tighten EGR cooler clamp nuts to 8 N·m (71 lbf·in).
Loosen both EGR clamp nuts two turns (720 degrees).
Tighten EGR cooler clamp nuts to a final torque of 7 N·m (60 lbf·in).
Tighten two M12 x 70 bolts to special torque (page 138).

figure.caption: Figure 2. Rear heat shield, exhaust side EGR cooler

step1.para: Position heat shield for installation and push down to fit in place.
Install heat shield slots over exhaust manifold stud bolts.
Install M10 x 20 bolt and tighten to standard torque (page 471).
Install two M8 heat shield nuts on exhaust manifold stud bolts and tighten to special torque (page 138).
